items.prompt: You ________ have car insurance to drive on public roads.
items.explanation: 'Must' expresses a legal obligation.

items.prompt: An insurance ________ is the contract between you and the insurance company.
items.explanation: A policy is the formal contract of insurance.

items.prompt: You ________ buy travel insurance if you go abroad.
items.explanation: 'Should' is used to give advice.

items.prompt: The monthly payment you make for your insurance is called the ________.
items.explanation: A premium is the amount paid for an insurance contract.

items.prompt: ________ insurance pays for your medical expenses if you are sick.
items.explanation: Health insurance covers medical costs.

items.prompt: We ________ to renew our home insurance next month.
items.explanation: We use 'need to' + verb to express necessity.

items.prompt: If you have an accident, you must file a ________ with your insurance company.
items.explanation: A claim is a formal request for payment based on the terms of the insurance policy.

items.prompt: You ________ share your insurance policy number with strangers.
items.explanation: 'Shouldn't' is used for negative advice.

items.prompt: ________ insurance provides financial support to your family after you die.
items.explanation: Life insurance pays out a sum of money on the death of the insured person.

items.prompt: You ________ read the fine print before signing the policy.
items.explanation: 'Must' expresses a strong necessity or obligation.

items.prompt: The insurance ________ helps you find the best deal for your needs.
items.explanation: An insurance broker is an intermediary who sells insurance.

items.prompt: You ________ to pay a deductible before the insurance company pays the rest.
items.explanation: 'Need' + to expresses necessity.

items.prompt: A ________ is the portion of any claim that you must pay yourself.
items.explanation: The deductible (or excess) is the amount the insured must pay before the insurer pays.

items.prompt: You ________ drive without insurance. It is illegal.
items.explanation: 'Mustn't' expresses prohibition.

items.prompt: ________ insurance covers damage to your house from fire or storms.
items.explanation: Home (or property) insurance covers the physical structure of a house.

items.prompt: Does this policy ________ theft of personal items?
items.explanation: To 'cover' means to provide insurance protection for something.

items.prompt: You ________ compare different companies before you buy a policy.
items.explanation: 'Should' is used for advice.

items.prompt: The insurance company ________ my claim because I was at fault.
items.explanation: To reject a claim means to refuse to pay it.

items.prompt: You ________ to provide proof of the damage.
items.explanation: Need + to expresses necessity.

items.prompt: ________ insurance is often required when you take out a mortgage.
items.explanation: Banks require property insurance to protect the house they are lending money for.

items.prompt: You ________ tell the truth on your insurance application.
items.explanation: 'Must' for a strong obligation.

items.prompt: The ________ is the person or entity protected by the insurance.
items.explanation: The insured is the person covered by the policy.

items.prompt: The ________ is the company that provides the insurance.
items.explanation: The insurer is the insurance company.

items.prompt: You ________ get a discount if you have a good driving record.
items.explanation: 'Might' expresses possibility.

items.prompt: We ________ renew our car insurance before it expires.
items.explanation: 'Should' for good advice.

items.text: You [must] have a valid license to drive. You [should] get a comprehensive policy if your car is new. You [need] to pay your premium every month.
items.explanation: Modals of obligation, advice, and necessity.

items.text: The [premium] is the cost of the insurance. The [deductible] is the part you pay in a claim. The [broker] helps you find a good price.
items.explanation: Common insurance terminology.

items.prompt: Does your insurance ________ international travel?
items.explanation: To cover means to include in the insurance protection.

items.prompt: You ________ leave your luggage unattended at the airport.
items.explanation: 'Shouldn't' for negative advice.

items.prompt: Liability ________ pays for damage you cause to other people.
items.explanation: Liability coverage protects you from legal responsibility for damage to others.

items.prompt: You ________ have a home security system to get a lower premium.
items.explanation: 'Should' for advice.

items.prompt: If you ________ a smoker, your life insurance premium will be higher.
items.explanation: First conditional 'if' clause: Present Simple.

items.prompt: You ________ to call the police if your car is stolen.
items.explanation: Need + to expresses necessity.

items.prompt: A ________ is an official document that describes your coverage.
items.explanation: An insurance certificate is proof of insurance.

items.prompt: You ________ cancel your policy at any time, but there might be a fee.
items.explanation: 'Can' expresses permission or possibility.

items.text: If you go skiing, you [should] get [travel] insurance that covers [accidents].
items.explanation: Specific insurance advice.

items.prompt: The ________ period is the time during which the insurance is active.
items.explanation: The policy period is the duration of the insurance contract.

items.prompt: You ________ notify the insurer of any changes in your circumstances.
items.explanation: 'Must' for a strong obligation.

items.prompt: A 'no-claims ________' reduces your premium if you don't file any claims.
items.explanation: A no-claims bonus is a discount for safe behavior.

items.prompt: You ________ pay your premium on time or your policy might be cancelled.
items.explanation: 'Must' for a strong necessity.
Correct order: 'You must have car insurance'.
Correct order: 'You should buy travel insurance'.
Correct order: 'We need to renew the policy'.

items.prompt: If you ________ your house, the insurance company will pay for the repairs.
items.explanation: To insure means to arrange for compensation in the event of damage.

items.prompt: The ________ is the maximum amount the insurance will pay.
items.explanation: The policy limit is the maximum benefit.

items.prompt: You ________ to fill out a claim form.
items.explanation: Need + to expresses necessity.

items.prompt: Some policies have ________, meaning they don't cover certain things.
items.explanation: Exclusions are things not covered by the policy.

items.prompt: You ________ have a health check-up before you get life insurance.
items.explanation: 'Might' for possibility.

items.prompt: ________ insurance is for your pets.
items.explanation: Pet insurance covers veterinary costs.

items.prompt: You ________ ask your broker for a better price.
items.explanation: 'Can' expresses possibility or permission.
